com.percussion.server
Interface IPSLoadableRequestHandler

All Superinterfaces:
IPSRequestHandler, IPSRootedHandler
public interface IPSLoadableRequestHandler
extends IPSRootedHandler

The IPSLoadableRequestHandler interface defines the mechanism by which a loadable request handler is initialized.

Method Summary
 void init(Collection requestRoots, InputStream cfgFileIn)
          Initializes the request handler.
 
Methods inherited from interface com.percussion.server.IPSRootedHandler

Methods inherited from interface com.percussion.server.IPSRequestHandler

Method Detail

init

void init(Collection requestRoots,
          InputStream cfgFileIn)
          throws com.percussion.conn.PSServerException
Initializes the request handler. Called by the server when the handler is loaded, before using the handler to process a request. The handler should perform any one time processing it needs to do before processing requests in this methos. Handlers are defined in the PSRequestHandlerConfiguration.

Parameters:
requestRoots - The list of request names which this handler wants to process as Strings, not null or empty. See description of RequestRoots element in DTD for Request Handler Configuration XML found in PSRequestHandlerConfiguration class description, and IPSRootedHandler for more information. This Collection of request roots should be used to implement the IPSRootedHandler.getRequestRoots() method.
cfgFileIn - An input stream to its config file if one is defined in the Request Handler Configuration. May be null if no config file is required. Handler is responsible for closing the stream when finished with it. See the configFile attribute of the RequestHandlerDef element defined in the PSRequestHandlerConfiguration class description for more information.
Throws:
com.percussion.conn.PSServerException - if the handler fails to initialize.
